resources.string: Why is this thing eating your battery?

Your device doesn\'t support In App Billing. You won\'t be able to purchase the Pro features of Unbounce. This could be because you need to update your Google Play Store application, or because you live in a country where In App Billing is disabled.
Do you want to change settings for a Wakelock or an Alarm, or do you want to reset stats for your device?
To Unbounce non-standard wakelocks and alarms, you need to purchase a donation package.
This alarm hasn\'t been proven safe to Unbounce. Would you like to Unbounce it anyway?
This wakelock hasn\'t been proven safe to Unbounce. Would you like to Unbounce it anyway?
This will reset stats for all of your wakelocks and alarms!
This will reset all of the settings for alarms and wakelocks!
Settings have been reset to defaults.

We don\'t have any information about this event, yet. This may not be safe to Unbounce. Only do so if you know what you\'re doing and you know how to disable Xposed at boot. We\'re working hard to collect information about every major wakelock and alarm. Please be patient while we collect this information.

NlpWakeLock is safe to unbounce. It\'s used by Google Play Services to determine your rough location using a combination of cell towers and WiFi. Once it has your location, it stores it locally so other apps, like Google Now, can access your location without using GPS or getting a new fix. Recommended settings are between 180 and 600 seconds.

NlpCollectorWakeLock is safe to unbounce. It\'s used by Google Play Services to determine your rough location using a combination of cell towers and wifi. Once it has your location, it sends it back to Google so they can expand their database of WiFi locations. Recommended settings are between 180 and 600 seconds.

This provides access to the system alarm services. When an alarm goes off, the Intent that had been registered for it is broadcast by the system, automatically starting the target application if it is not already running. Registered alarms are retained while the device is asleep (and can optionally wake the device up if they go off during that time), but will be cleared if it is turned off and rebooted.
Audio playback when your screen is turned off. If you disable this, you won\'t have background audio or music able to play when your screen is off.
Interacts with the overall activities running in the system. If you Unbounce this, nothing will work well.

This is an Android System level WakeLock. The interface that apps use to talk to the window manager - meaning, applications will require a WindowManager lock everytime they need to be shown on the screen.
RILJ keeps your device awake while processing phone actions, such as phone calls and cell tower communication.

This is the WakeLock used by Android SyncManager to Sync accounts like Google+, Twitter, Linkedin, Gmail etc. The higher the unbouncing, the longer the amount of time until your accounts will get synced again.
ICING is a Google Services WakeLock. Currently looking for more details.
This WakeLock can usually be associated with Calendar, although may effect other apps such as messaging. If your Calendar has notifications / alerts it can hold this WakeLock.
This WakeLock handles Touch Sounds and Alert Sounds among others. It has plagued some devices even with Touch Sounds turned off.
As the name implies. This is not typically a high battery drainer for some it might held a big wakelock.
This wakelock is used to hold the device awake listening for Google Search/Hotword Detection. "Okay, Google"
Related to NFC service routing detected tags to the appropriate application.
Used by Google Location Services to report your current location.
Verizon specific location service used for cell tower statistics.
Google Hangouts. If you Unbounce this, Hangouts will no longer work.
Google Cloud Messaging. Sends lightweight messages to your apps. Responsible for sending push notifications to your phone, for all apps.

Cloud to Device Messaging (C2DM) is a service that helps developers send data to their apps on devices. The service provides a mechanism that servers can use to tell mobile applications to contact the server to fetch updated application or user data. The C2DM service handles all aspects of queueing of messages and delivery to the target application running on target devices. This service was deprecated since 2012 but there are still apps that are using this service instead of the new and improved GCM.
This is a core part of Android that is best left alone. It queues up all incoming events.

This alarm is safe to unbounce. It\'s used by Google Play Services to determine your rough location using a combination of cell towers and WiFi. Once it has your location, it stores it locally so other apps, like Google Now, can access your location without using GPS or getting a new fix. Recommended settings are between 180 and 600 seconds.

This alarm is safe to unbounce. It\'s used by Google Play Services to determine your rough location using a combination of cell towers and wifi. Once it has your location, it sends it back to Google so they can expand their database of WiFi locations. Recommended settings are between 180 and 600 seconds.
The listener which updates your Google Hangouts notifications.

Wakelock from com.android.phone (Phone app) when using Data through Cellular towers. Using WiFi will not trigger this alarm. Usually it gets through the roof while using data, especially on a mediocre connection.

This app will always let you fix the Network Location Provider battery killers for free. If you\'d also like to Unbounce other wakelocks and alarms, you can upgrade to the Pro features by supporting the project below. Any donation amount will unlock the Pro features.
A cup of coffee while I write code
A latte while I answer forum questions
The joy of not carrying your charger

Thank you for your donation. It means a lot to me. I work hard in my limited free time to bring you better battery life. When you donated, you made a difference to the project, and made a difference in my family\'s life. You rock.

People have asked how they can contribute beyond their initial donation. The buttons below let you donate further, but don\'t provide any additional features. Thank you so much for supporting Unbounce!
Let\'s make sure everything is setup.
Something went wrong. Let\'s find out what and get it fixed...
We\'ve setup some battery saving defaults for you. Enjoy your new battery life!
It looks like you haven\'t enabled the Unbounce module. Click \"FIX IT\", make sure Unbounce is checked, then reboot.
Xposed isn\'t running. Click \"FIX IT\", then click \"Install/Update\" and reboot your device.

Xposed isn\'t installed. Xposed is required for Unbounce and many other root applications. Once the download is finished, click INSTALL, then launch Unbounce again.\nIf you\'d like to learn more about Xposed, visit Tested.com.
It looks like your device isn\'t rooted. Unbounce requires a rooted device to function properly. If you\'re interested in rooting your device, please visit Techverse.net to get started.
Download failed. Please try again later.
Reset all alarms and wakelocks to default settings
Override your locale settings and use English
Unbounce uses the Xposed Framework and will install it for you if you don\'t already have it.

Unsolicited quotes from real users: "It gave me about 2 hours more use with 30 minutes more screen on time. Saved me from buying a $25 battery." "Just donated 5 Dollars to support this masterpiece.. Keep up the good work" "Simply amazing" "[Unbounce] just revolutionized the true meaning of wakelock managing" "This module is awesome! I get less than a half percent drain per hour for idle standby. " ...and many more.
Unbounce puts you in control of how your device uses your battery by controlling how often your device can wake up, and how long it can stay awake. Use the recommended settings for easy battery savings, or dig in and customize every alarm and wakelock on your device. Here are some highlights:
- A beautiful design, inspired by Material Design principles - A stable blocking engine - Comprehensive measuring of the time wasted and time saved because of alarms and wakelocks - A growing list of descriptions of the alarms and wakelocks in plain English (and other languages coming soon!) - A new Pro package that lets you Unbounce any alarm or wakelock on the device - An open source codebase so you can see how it works, or build it yourself
The In-App purchases allow you to unlock the Pro package that lets you customize the alarms and wakelocks on your device. Without the pro package, you can control the worst battery hogs: NlpWakelock, NlpCollectorWakeLock, ALARM_WAKEUP_LOCATOR, and ALARM_WAKE_ACTIVITY_DETECTION.
May you have a long [battery] life!
